div.p: It happens quite a lot... Not a lot but it happens probably at least on a yearly round, you know there’s always going to be a time
when things get hard for example this year, you know you’ve just graduated, the economy is not fantastic and you know you apply for a lot of jobs
and it’s so competitive and it’s really hard and there’s times when you think Oh I just can’t do anything, you know I’m not going to get a job
I’m not going to succeed and you know when it gets hard you get really low but you’ve just got to endure that stuff, you know it’s the same
when you’ve got your exams you think maybe I haven’t got the grades or maybe I’ll never amount to anything but you know you just stick
it out, commit to whatever you’re doing and you know whether you do or don’t make the grade or get the job there’s always another way of getting there
like going into architecture for example I definitely did not have the grades to sort of get into some of the better universities
they were looking for like A, B, B and I got 3 Cs so what I did was I started looking for new courses because at least I know
they’re going to put the money in the right places, they’re going to get the best tutors that they can to sort of build that course’s profile
and it paid off, you know like you’ve got to find a way around it, there’s always a way around it and just don’t be deterred by bad results
you know they’re always going to happen at some stage in your life.
